180976.name: The Barreville Flap
180976.description:
The Hook

A series of UFO sightings and cattle mutilations (an event known in Ufology as a "flap") in the north-central Montana town of Barreville leads representatives of Project Moon Dust to investigate.

180977.description:
Offland is a world where hundreds of races live together. It's not easy to keep peace between hundreds of races, so every ten years, each race sends its best mage to the ruins to participate in Magecraft. Only the winner of this competition receives the magic gems as a prize, with this mage's race dominating the land for the next decade. Now the competition starts again; who shall rise and who shall fall?

Magecraft is a bag-building game that's suitable for 2~4 players. As a player in Magecraft, you learn spells, build a mana pool, and collect mana gems. Whoever collects twenty mana gems in their score area first wins! An additional copy of the game is required to play with 3 and 4 players.
180977.name: Magecraft

180978.name: Skylords: Warriors of The Wind Core Set
180978.description:
SkyLords is a game of mid-air jousting where warriors leap from towers and clash in flight. The combat tests skills of both agility and brute strength. A powerful, heavy fighter may offer up a formidable defense, but a lighter opponent can attack from above. It is crucial to find a balance between power and weight that will beat the strategy of your opponent.

Games of SkyLords are for 2 players, ages 12 and over. Players draw from the same deck, which must contain at least 26 cards.

Before beginning, players set the number of starting Game Points, which corresponds to the amount of Life each player starts with.

At the end of each turn, players deduct Game Points corresponding to the amount of damage received. The first player to reach zero loses.

180979.name: Galaxy Defenders Master Alien: Xeno-Lord
180979.description: This master alien was released as part of the second Galaxy Defenders kickstarter. It is useable in custom scenarios and downloadable scenarios.

180980.name: Galaxy Defenders Master Alien: The Experiment
180980.description: The experiment was released as a master alien during the second kickstarter campaign of Galaxy Defenders. It can be added as an additional master alien to battle in the base game.

180981.name: Wer wird denn weinen?
180981.description:
Each player has a set of 4 pawns that start in his or her corner of the board. The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "home" section. Movement is determined by a die. The Players have to pay an entry of game coins into the bank. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home". pawns can be brought into play by rolling the number indicated at the "home" sections.

In game 1 up to 3 players share one game track (red or black). If a player gets on a "W"-space, the pawn either is returned to the players corner and has to start anew, or the player has to pay a prior fixed amount of game coins into the bank. If a pawn would get on a space, that is alredy occupied by another pawn, it jumps over and gets one space ahead.

In game 2 all players move around the same game track and may capture each others pawns. Captured pawns are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. If a pawn gets on a "W"-space, the player has to pay a prior fixed amount of game coins into the bank. If the "W"-space is already oppupied, the first pawn gets captured and it's player has to pay the same amount of game coins to the owner of the second pawn.

The clover on the cover may indicate that this game was published by Klee

180982.name: Galaxy Defenders: Elite Alien Legion
180982.description: The elite alien legion was released as part of the second Galaxy Defenders kickstarter. It can be fully integrated with the base game and the expansions for Galaxy Defenders in order to provide a more difficult challenge.

180983.name: Galaxy Defenders: Vintage Weapon Set 1
180983.description: These weapons were released as a part of the second Galaxy Defenders Kickstarter. They can be used and implemented into the core game or its expansions in order to change out the original weapon layout of the agents.

180984.name: Galaxy Defenders: 5th Column
180984.description: This expansion was released during the second Galaxy Defenders kickstarter. It includes 2 agents and 2 new power armors to use with the base game or expasions.

180985.name: Osprey
180985.description:
From publisher blurb:

Osprey

A man of mystery, the Osprey is a crafty, ruthless predator who methodically stalks and kills “heroes.” He is the anti-Raven—a defender of lawlessness and an enemy of the good. The Osprey is a genuinely evil, cold, and calculating genius who takes pleasure in systematically dismantling the lives of heroes. He’s unlike any foe your heroes have ever faced.

180986.name: Primordial Machine
180986.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long ago the gods and primordials fought a war on an unfathomable scale, and in the end both lost. The world and heavens were shattered, as were the metaphysical barriers that separated the rest of the planes. This was the Sundering, a cosmic cataclysm that annihilated most of what had been wrought.

Most.

The Legion was one such creation that survived, an army of machines constructed specifically to fight and conquer. They weren’t activated during the war, and remained sealed away in a sentient armory until long after the tremors of the Sundering ceased. Once the armory determined that the progeny of the gods had also survived the Sundering, it activated and set them loose upon the Remnants.

Primordial Machine is an introductory adventure that gives you a glimpse into A Sundered World, an upcoming campaign setting for Dungeon World.

One way or another, the characters arrive on an island harboring a Legion hive, and must destroy them before they can complete construction of a new primordial.

This product comes with both color and black and white pdfs, in case you want to save yourself some ink printing it yourself (or just prefer black and white).

In addition, it includes previews for four of the six new classes: the battlemind, nomad, shaman, and warlock. A separate pdf contains letter-sized character sheets for each, and there's enough advanced moves to play each of them up until about 6th-level.

180987.name: Galaxy Defenders Master Alien: Kingator
180987.description: The kingator is a master alien for use with the expansions of Galaxy Defenders which was relesed during the second Galaxy Defenders kickstarter. It can be used to increase the difficulty of the game and add variety.

180988.name: Worlds of Power
180988.description:
From publisher blurb:

Drawn from the entries of the 2015 Spheres of Power Worldbuilding Contest, this 45 page PDF features three entire worlds for your campaigning pleasure!

Along with setting info, story hooks, and adventuring guidelines, each world comes with its own set of custom mechanics that can easily be adapted to a variety of worlds, including new magic talents, alternate classes and class features, custom XP systems, and fun alternative methods of item crafting and handling player wealth!

Inside this volume you'll find:

Grimoire: Featuring new and alternative classes including the Mage, the Wunderkind, the Exemplar, the Shaman, and the Dendrite, guidelines for chapter-based character progression, and a new material: Pirium!




First the Strangers came and elevated the animals and taught them magic. Then, the world cracked like an egg as the North Axis was flung into orbit. In this world, adventurers take their place in an infant world struggling through its childhood as numerous new races learn to live with each other, and the aftermath of the world's breaking...

Erda: Featuring Paragon rules, coin-less item creation, a handful of new feats and Ki powers, and 3 fully-stated NPCs for use with Spheres of Power!




The mad prophet Kothar and his empire march across the land, razing nations to the ground and assassinating any king who would dare to oppose them. With nothing but a handful of refugees and the Bloodmother's united orcish horde standing in his way, the time has come for heroes to choose the course of the world...

Irhardt: Featuring the Affinity system that exchanges alignment for elemental focus, several new Destruction talents, and a new race (the angelic aielari)!




With their advanced technology, the Zethian Empire has made it their mission to slaughter the divinities. With their Dragon divinities, the Kingdom of Atonia matched them to a stalemate. But now that the Elemental Dragons have vanished, there's no telling what the Zethians might do, or who might have the power to stop them...

180989.name: Universal Adventures Adventure Module #6: Chamber of Blood
180989.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dusk settles over the silent streets of Ravenor as the remaining residents hasten to be indoors, racing against the sinking sun. There, behind barred doors and bolted shutters they await the coming of the dawn and news of the next horrific discovery to be made on the streets that used to be their home.

Welcome to Universal Adventures Chamber of Blood!

Universal Adventures Chamber of Blood is the sixth release in the Adventure Module series set in and under the town of Ravenor and this adventure is loaded with fantastic, imagination-firing, dungeon-adventuring fun and excitement. The Adventure Module includes a new Adventure Record, 9 Adventure cards, 9 Encounter cards, 9 Event cards, 9 Search cards, 18 Treasure cards, and 27 cards for new special areas and features. Chamber of Blood also introduces an all new type of card, the Lore card. The Adventure Module brings you 9 Lore cards, which draw your characters into the adventure and add a whole new dimension to the game.

J really pushed the bounds of imagination and creativity with Chamber of Blood and we hope it will bring you a great gaming experience. Chamber of Blood is the most engrossing, imaginative Adventure Module to date and certainly the most deadly. The characters will enter deadly new environments and face dangerous new foes. Not to mention a host of new cards to add to your collection. Play this adventure and you’ll be talking about it long after the dice have stopped rolling.

Suitable for use with any fantasy role playing game, Chamber of Blood can be played solo or with a group, with or without a GM. The adventure is highly re-playable and compatible with other Universal Adventures cards. In addition, you can combine the cards with other cards from the series, or cards from other Universal Adventures products, to create your own adventures.

180990.name: Cults of Celmae: The Ashen King
180990.description:
From publisher blurb:

He is the Ashen King, Celmae's god of fire and death, and he wants nothing more than to burn every living soul.

Contained herein:

An overveiw of the cult of the Ashen King.
New spells, boons, items, and monsters dedicated to this foul god. Make every threat as dangerous as possible!
NPC's ready to hinder and harm your heroes.
Story Hooks.
And Much More!

180991.name: Cinematic Dinosaurs Volume I
180991.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dinosaurs As They Were Always Meant to Be!

Dinosaurs occupy a special place in our imagination. On the one hand, they are awe-inspiring creatures of myth and fantasy, terrible draconic creatures which no human has ever lain eyes upon, stars of novels, television, and movies. On the other hand, they were real, mundane animals, not so different from the animals we know in modern day times. As a result, dinosaurs occupy a nebulous space between fantasy and reality, and require a delicate balance to handle well.

The dinosaurs included in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Bestiary do an excellent job of presenting one interpretation of dinosaurs: that of being large, but nonetheless mundane animals, differing from a bear or elephant only in Hit Dice and size category. Like other animals, they receive little in the way of special abilities or mechanics to make them come alive at the game table. With Weekly Wonders: Cinematic Dinosaurs Volume I, we present a different interpretation of dinosaurs, one which draws on the more fantastical elements of these creatures, as seen in movies, television, games, and more. Though they are decidedly non-magical in nature, these dinosaurs can hardly be said to be mundane, with numerous new and exciting special abilities designed to evoke the sorts of action attributed to dinosaurs in other media.

In this book, you will find:

The primordial triceratops (CR 11), whose massive bulk cripples those it tramples, and which can impale opponents on its three massive horns.
The primordial tyrannosaurus rex (CR 12), whose very presence inspires fear, and whose roar can reduce even the stoutest hearts to quivering jelly, whose teeth can snap bones like twigs, and who can burst through nearly any obstacle without even slowing down.
Supplemental rules applicable to all dinosaurs and other creatures of immense size, which focus on bashing objects, including rules to make attempts to break objects more exciting and cinematic, break DCs for a variety of objects a dinosaur might want to destroy (including trees, rocks, and entire buildings of various sizes and materials), and rules for bashing large objects to shake free creatures hiding atop them.

180992.name: Victory's Vault Volume 1, Issue 12
180992.description:
From publisher blurb:


"Every Item Touched by Victory!"

You can call her Phane Wonderra... she represents an ancient race that pursues the practice of Victory, and if you've got the cash, to the vault of their star fortress. They've compiled quite a stock of items with one thing in common; they've all proved their value in battle by being on the winner's side. Every item has been literally touched by Victory! Each installment of Victory's Vaults includes...

A fine selection of weapons of the Era
A unique item of armor
A vehicle the suit the needs of hero and/or villain
A "white elephant," such as a new animal, a playable Package, some new Special Abilities, or a place to explore and perhaps purchase!




Also includes some notes on how Phae Wonderra pitches these fine items, and the potential benefits (or consequences!) of haggling. Want more stuff? You can't do much better than to look in Victory's Vault!

180993.name: Angry Birds POP!
180993.description:
Angry Birds meets bubble shooter in an all-new and super-addictive puzzler! Use your slingshot to match and burst colorful bubbles, save exotic critters, and topple the piggies. Strategic and intuitive gameplay make for a challenging and satisfying bubble popping experience!

Source: The Publisher Website.

180994.description:
AFTERSHOCK: A Humanitarian Crisis Game is a boardgame that explores the interagency cooperation needed to address the emergency and early recovery phase of a complex humanitarian crisis. It is intended both for hobby play and for use in professional education about humanitarian assistance and disaster relief.

The game is set in the fictional country of Carana, but is loosely modeled on disasters such as the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami and the 2010 Haiti earthquake. It explores approximately three months of humanitarian operations, including both the initial emergency and a later period of early recovery. Because Carana is a fragile, conflict- affected country, relief and reconstruction efforts may also involve issues of social unrest and political instability, especially during the early recovery stage once the initial shock of the crisis has worn off.

The primary objective of all players is to address the urgent humanitarian needs of the local population (thereby scoring "relief points"). However, players also need to maintain public and political support for their organizations ("operations points"), whether to govern (Carana), sustain the relief mission (HADR-TF), or secure financial support (UN and NGOs).

"At-Risk" cards indicate the current emergency needs for food, water/sanitation, medical, or shelter supplies in each district of the capital. Players must bring the necessary supplies into the country, and allocate aid teams to deliver them in time. Aid teams might also be engaged in rescue operations, aid coordination, needs assessment, infrastructure repair, public relations or other key tasks. Event cards inject many of the numerous challenges associated with relief operations into game play, but also indicate the self-help efforts of the local population as they struggle to survive and recover.

Game play is cooperative, but it is possible for some, all, or no player to win.
180994.name: AFTERSHOCK: A Humanitarian Crisis Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: GrogCast Season 2, Episode 12

rpgseries: RPG Geek One Sheet GUMSHOE Contest 2015
180995.name: Monster Squad Control
180995.description:
Introduction

This is a GUMSHOE scenario designed to be played via video-chat software such as Skype or Google Hangouts. You and your fellow players are Control Room Administrators for Monster Squad, an Internet-based startup that kills monsters for a reasonable fee. Most of you work from home, though hotdesking facilities are available at the branch offices, which Monster Squad has in Seattle, Melbourne, and – for tax reasons – Grand Cayman.
When working on a mission, you communicate by video conferencing. Your GM plays the Operative – your agent on the ground. You can only communicate with the Operative through audio (i.e. the GM’s camera will be turned off).

180996.name: In The Very End of Harvest
rpgseries: RPG Geek One Sheet GUMSHOE Contest 2015
180996.description:
The Job

Iraqi warlord Faris Abd al-Mumīn has survived a long time; through the revolution, the Iran-Iraq war, the Saddam years and both invasions of Iraq by the US. He prospered under al-Maliki, but now with the rise of DAESH (ISIL to the westerners) and the failure of the Iraqi state, he has seen the writing on the wall. Getting himself and his legitimate assets out of the country is relatively uncomplicated. Getting the millions in US currency embezzled from Iraqi reconstruction funds, CIA bribes, and stolen cultural artifacts is a lot more complicated. The loot is in play and the Agents have been tasked to retrieve it.

180997.name: Flagship: A Game of Naval Action
180997.description:
A WWII era naval-themed game game of strategy for two players. The object is to attack and capture the opponents flagship with one of your submarines. The game setup and play is very similar to the later and more well known Stratego. Each player sets a "fleet" of 20 ships on the first three rows (24 spaces)of the 8x8 gridded board nearest its home base. Four spaces are left vacant. As in Stratego the placement/order of battle is hidden from the opponent. One side is chosen to go first and movement is one space in any unoccupied direction with alternating turns. Attacks are made when one piece moves to a vacant space directly in front of an opponent's piece and the rank/class of the ship is announced. The ship with the highest assigned value is the winner and the lesser piece is removed from the board. If both have the same value, they're both removed. One important difference is that each side is given 4 Submarines with the lowest assigned value of 1, but they take ALL pieces except the 4 Subchasers (value 2). Attacks need not be made when a piece moves into attack position. If no value is announced with the move, the piece acts a block to the opposing piece. The player whose Submarine attacks the opponents flagship first wins the game. If both flagships are removed through a draw attack, the game continues until one fleet is removed entirely from the board or the game may be called a draw.

Fleet pieces/order of battle

1 Flagship - value 10
1 Battle Cruiser - value 8
2 Battleships - value 6
2 Cruisers - value 5
3 Destroyers - value 4
3 Torpedo Boats - value 3
4 Subchasers - value 2
4 Submarines - value 1

20 pieces in each fleet (red and blue). Pieces are made of wood.
